sub_title: Agile, Innovation, Energy Transition, Team Coach (ORSC)
summary:
A geoscientist focused on creating value through integration across technical and organizational disciplines with a drive to deliver products that steer business decisions. A proven track record of over 15 years leading the delivery of complex and capital intensive projects in international settings. A reputation as a creative change agent through agile ways of working with an eye for HSSE and people. Core values of Courage, Authenticity, Responsibility. Passionate about change, innovation, business improvement, care, and team performance, both inside Shell and in non-profit counselor and board positions.

Strong combination of technical and management experience with a focus on delivery, value creation, process optimization, and portfolio management. Proven ability to develop strategy with direct links to business choices, and implementation.

Thrives in international and intercultural settings. Eye for people, diversity, development, health, and safety.

awards.title: 2022 EVP Powering Progress Award
awards.description: Team got rewarded for pivoting the maturation of one of Shell's Carbon Capture technologies, integrating 4 sub teams into one integrated team, and finding alternative pathways to de-risk and create value.

projects.title: Regional petroleum potential screening studies
projects.description: Studies of the Western Deformation Front (Pre-Cambrian fold-and thrust belt) and the Ghaba Salt Basin in Oman, leading to either an acreage divestment decision, or a plan to de-risk and mature the area.

projects.title: Greater lekhwair derisking
projects.description: developed a strategy to de-risk a 2000km2 area, with oil is trapped in a paleo closure above a tilted contact. Through efficient stakeholder engagement, exploration and the production asset agreed to step away from booking small polygons around wells towards de-risking the entire area with a limited number of exploration wells, followed by a series of appraisal wells. The project went from initiation to first well in 6 months, and now fills the entire sequence for one rig in 2014. Authored the well proposals for the exploration wells, operational well owner for the first 3 wells.

authors.headline: Agile, Innovation, Energy Transition, Team Coach (ORSC)

profile_positions.description: My team provides agile leadership to innovation in the energy transition. In my role at the Energy Transition Campus Amsterdam, I lead the design and implementation of various (scaled) agile ways of working and I coach (leadership) teams using agile and systemic approaches.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Agile Lead

profile_positions.description:
My team is recognized as front-runner in Agile ways of working in Shell Exploration. Team performance  is maximised through focus on purpose, goals, and priorities. I role-model the learner mindset, vulnerability, transparency, and care leading to a high-trust team environment where honest feedback is the norm. 
As Scrum Master, I deepened the agile way of working towards the timely delivery of high-quality products for decisions.
Technical oversight for all subsurface work for the Mauritania venture (core team of 5, 5-6 specialist support). Technical stakeholder management, coaching and mentoring of staff.

Influencer on agile ways of working  and diversity on Yammer with 14 posts, 2900 views, 72 reactions, and 190 video views. Member of the MEA Business transformation team, coaching and supporting other teams to adapt agile ways of working.
profile_positions.title: Technical Leader, Scrum Master, Business Transformation

profile_positions.description:
First Shell Niger delta-wide PBE study. Maximised the value of the study outcome by the development a new way to estimate remaining volumes and rank licenses based on value. Responsible for the development of new seismic attribute screening methodology and added significant volume to Shell’s portfolio. 
HSSE: implemented weekly mood measures to address workload, stress, and team behaviors, creating a safe environment for people to speak up, leading to more engaged team, with better team atmosphere, and more care. 
Complex project planning for core team of 8 staff, and 15 specialists.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Team Lead, Agile Developer, Team Performance

profile_positions.description:
Maximise performance: Led an integrated team and delivered updated evaluation leading to a accelerated country exit and significant cost savings.
Maximise learnings through presentations of evaluation workflow and outcome to other exploration teams.

Communicated a difficult decision to (government) stakeholders. Managed country exit process together with key external stakeholders and Shell legal, finance, and the venture.
profile_positions.title: Technical leader, Venture leader

company.name: The Royal Geological and Mining Society of the Netherlands (KNGMG)

profile_positions.company: The Royal Geological and Mining Society of the Netherlands (KNGMG)
profile_positions.description: Member of the board of the Royal Geological and Mining Society of the Netherlands (KNGMG).
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description:
Member of a joint technical/commercial team evaluating business opportunities in Sub Saharan Africa.

Subsurface lead: Data room visits, play and prospect maturation, V2V of the Lacustrine synrift play West Africa. First exploration competitive scoping V2V led to significantly lower E&A costs.

Divestment G&G lead: Responsible for all G&G input for a major producing asset divestment and country exit, due diligence, IM, data room preparation, and hosting. Exploration support in Shell's technical divestment teams.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Exploration Geologist - Deal Delivery

profile_positions.description:
I lead projects to develop a method to select those items in PDO’s exploration portfolio that that can be grouped into projects, which best suit the exploration strategy to deliver both material frontier opportunities, and short to mid-term low cost volumes.

In the first project (team of 12 staff), the portfolio for the Haushi play on in the Eastern Flank area of Oman was increased by one third in size and number of leads. Rather than individual prospects, three projects (6 prospects) were included in the 5 year business plan for 2016. Another 96 prospects were handed over to the production assets for fast-tracked development.
The second project highlighted 3 potential areas for growth in the Ara play, and delivered one project (3 prospects) for the 2016 business plan.

The developed method was successfully applied to the rest of the exploration portfolio, driving the change from individual prospects to projects, and is taken up as a standard in the exploration-maturation process. The new process allows for value-drive, cost-neutral exploration and leads to more stability in the drill cycle.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead - Strategic Plays

profile_positions.description:
In my time in PDO, I added 2 material new play segments to the very mature South Oman Salt Basin.

Proposed the 1st horizontal (1000m) exploration well in the Ara stringer play (Cambrian carbonates encased in salt). Written the well proposal, and operational well owner.

Project lead responsible for developing a strategy to de-risk a 2000km2 area, with oil is trapped in a paleo closure above a tilted contact. Through efficient stakeholder engagement, exploration and the production asset agreed to step away from booking small polygons around wells towards de-risking the entire area with a limited number of exploration wells, followed by a series of appraisal wells. The project went from initiation to first well in 6 months, and filled the entire sequence for one rig in 2014. Authored the well proposals for the exploration wells, operational well owner for the first 3 wells.

Leading 2 regional studies inside PDO's acreage, with a 5 man team (partially Shell international staff based outside Oman).

Process improvement: Developed an on-line tool manage and QC exploration well planning; Reduced process cycle time by at least 50%. LEAN approach to volumes and risking led to a 70% reduction in cycle time.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Exploration Geologist

profile_positions.description:
Play owner for the Ara play.
The Ara play is Pre Cambrian to Cambrian in age, and is a complex system of carbonate reservoirs often encased in salt (stringers). Within PDO, I am the focal point for exploration for this play, keeping track of all the developments in the play, capturing the corporate knowledge, and advising management and shareholders on the state of the play. In this role I am responsible for the initiation and coordination of (academic) studies, working together with a wide range of contractors and researchers.

Northern Carbonate Domain project lead.
Responsible for the seismic interpretation of a ~4000km2 greenfield area in Oman, covered by 2D and 3D data. Responsible for regional seismic interpretation, lead mapping on 4 different play levels, volume calculations. Involved in the entire exploration cycle from new data acquisition and processing to prospect maturation.

Play studies coordinator.
Managed a budget of ±$1.5mln for oil and gas contracted (academic) studies.
profile_positions.title: Exploration Geologist

profile_positions.description:
Exploration Geologist working for Global New Ventures. In this job I mostly work on large scale regional studies.

Other activities at Shell include assessment of graduate job candidates, member of the Rijswijk Diversity and Inclusiveness network, and Focal point for the Basin Master at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: Exploration Geologist

profile_positions.description: Post doc position; fieldwork in the Southern Rhine Graben measuring kinematic indicators on faults in order to reconstruct the opening of the Rhine Graben. Work resulted in a paper in the Journal of Structural Geology
profile_positions.title: Post Doc

profile_positions.description: The geological and modelling work for my thesis was done in Amsterdam. Obtained PhD degree in Geology in May 2004
profile_positions.title: PhD student Structural Geology and Tectonics

profile_positions.description: PhD project: '3D Geophysical imaging and tectonic modelling of the active tectonics of the Uper Rhine Graben'. In this project, I combined different types of Earthquake tomographies with potential fields data, reflection seismics, and surface geology to come to an integrated model of the recent tectonics in the Upper Rhine Graben region (France, Germany, Switzerland). Obtained PhD degree in geophysics in December 2003.
profile_positions.title: PhD student Earthquake geophysics

volunteer_experiences.description: Deputy chair of the board of a local Montessori school. Executive responsibility on the subjects of quality and safety, and human resources. Supervisory responsibility for all other board matters. School received compliments at the 2020 inspection by the ministry of education. The school has the ambition to be CO2 neutral within 5 years.
